results.title: The King: Wayne Carey
results.creator_credit: Visual Entertainment Group and Stephen Phillips
results.brief_description: There is no more influential or imposing figure in football today than the Kangaroos captain; Wayne Carey. Voted as the greatest player of the twentieth century by Leigh Matthews, Carey has stamped his mark as the dominant centre half forward of his era in over 200 games. All Australian captain, quadruple club champion, leading goalkicker, Carey has earned himself the worthy reputation of “King”. In this program Carey reflects on the memorable moments of his career, there are also revealing interviews with coach Denis Pagan as well as team mates and opponents.

results.title: The King who loved his family
results.brief_description: A film of historical interest showing many of the less well known photographs of events in the life of the late King George VI. Made on the occassion of his death, the film is a tribute to a man and his family. Includes the funeral procession of King George’s grandfather; the ‘Spreading Chestnut Tree’ game in which the King participated at a holiday camp; the King yachting with his father; the visit to Australia; shipboard games en route to South Africa; an early visit to France; extracts from the abdication speech of King Edward.

results.title: The King of New York
results.creator_credit: Reteitalia, Mary Kane, Vittorio Squillante and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: Christopher Walken stars as a drug lord turned good guy in this crime film directed by Abel Ferrara. Frank White is released from prison, a reformed man and sets out to take over New York City, in order to prevent the closure of a hospital in the South Bronx where he grew up. With the help of a few gangster friends, he begins to take over the entire drug industry in the city, killing those standing in his way. As his takeover begins to succeed he brings in more recruits, but unknowingly starts a underground war between crime groups in the city. Cast also includes Larry Fishburne, Wesley Snipes, David Caruso and Steve Buscemi.

results.title: The King of Marvin Gardens
results.brief_description: Radio personality David Staebler (Jack Nicholson), uses his brother’s life story as fodder for his radio ramblings, thus anticipating the “talk jocks” of the 1980’s and 90’s. David’s brother Jason (Bruce Dern), is full of lofty ambitions but lacks the wherewithal to accomplish them. He has managed to survive for so long thanks to the help of his older brother. His latest vision for success involves building a resort on a small Hawaiian island and he intends to raise the capital by holding a beauty contest and wining and dining rich Japanese businessmen. Along with Jason’s long suffering wife (Ellen Burstyn), David reluctantly agrees to support his brother one more time.

results.title: The King of comedy
results.creator_credit: Embassy International Pictures, Arnon Milchan and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: Rupert Pupkin (Robert De Niro), is an aspiring comedian obsessed with TV talk show host, Jerry Langford (Jerry Lewis). After co-ordinating a meeting with his idol, Rupert tells Langford about the comedy material he has written. Langford is as charming as he is dismissive, and after being repeatedly rejected and eventually ejected by Langford’s staff, Rupert decides to take matters into his own hands, conspiring a sensationally irresponsible scheme to beat defeat. The ‘King of Comedy’ is widely seen as Martin Scorsese’s cynically black-comic reaction to the media firestorm that followed his 1976 film ‘Taxi Driver’.

results.title: The King and the nightingale
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company, Masaji Hara, Shigeki Ishikawa, Matsue Jimbo and Ryuhi Watanabe
results.brief_description: A puppet animation version of Hans Christian Andersen’s fairy tale of a king who discovers just in time the value of the nightingale and its beautiful song.

results.title: The King and I
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Charles Brackett and Walter Lang
results.brief_description: This visual and musical masterpiece features Yul Brynner’s Academy Award winning performance, an unforgettable Rodgers and Hammerstein score, and brilliant choreography by Jerome Robbins. It tells the true story of an Englishwoman, Anna Leonowens who comes to Siam as a school teacher to the royal court in the 1860’s. Winner of five Academy Awards, “The King and I” contains some of the most lavish sets and costumes in Hollywood history, and some of the world’s best loved songs. Also stars Deborah Kerr.

results.title: The King's musick
results.creator_credit: Angel Productions, Daniel M. Angel and Victor M. Gover
results.brief_description: A tour of inspection of the Royal Military School of Music at Knellar Hall, Britain. Shows early musical instruments such as the serpent, the shawn and the French hunting horn, and gives an insight into the various methods of training, in conducting and in the playing of different instruments. The film closes with an open air performance of ‘The Evening hymn’ and ‘Abide with me’.
